primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, through the event of the Trinity (Incarnation/Cross), reaches out to and cleanses the 'ungodly' and 'unwashed' to create a new community of reconciled relationships.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically the Triune God in Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: I am saved by God — the God who in Christ is reaching out
All the dirt was assumed by God himself in the person of his Son
He [God] has gone before us... and lo, Jesus is with us always

object.identificatie: The 'ungodly', the 'unwashed', and the reconciliation of the world.
tekstueel_bewijs: the good news of God’s salvation for all people
to reconcile the whole world to God

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (The Father/Son/Holy Spirit relationship)
tekstueel_bewijs: True relationships originate in God himself
The Trinity is the wellspring of a new humanity

ontvanger.identificatie: The ungodly, the irreligious, and the multicultural world.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit and the 'unlikely messengers' (like William).
tekstueel_bewijs: the Holy Spirit was teaching me
the most unlikely messengers may at any time be preachers
the dirt of China, Liberia... and all the ethnic hatreds
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'dirt' that requires a divine sacrifice and the 'unifying vision' of God to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church (the saved) testifying and giving away the good news to the nations.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (evangelism) is presented as an overflow of the primary program (salvation). We give it away because it was first given to us.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God in Christ is reaching out
He [God] evangelizes them through the small
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I am not saved by doing the right thing
we cannot possibly keep it to ourselves

voorbeelden: Withholding this good news would be a betrayal
It [Good News] wants to share itself
It wants to go beyond its own good fortune
the Holy Spirit was teaching me
All power is given unto me
In God there is enough strength to overthrow

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power (Pouvoir) to save and the inherent 'wanting' (Vouloir) of the Gospel to spread, rather than the hearer's obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Religion) to S2 (Dirt) and finally to S1 (Grace) which resolves S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The 'Dirt' is assumed by Christ on the cross, allowing the 'Ungodly' to move directly to 'Grace' without passing through 'Religion'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; 'Dirt' is the universal human condition that only God can clean.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and defines the human condition as one of 'dirt' that cannot be self-cleansed.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Five missionaries... have put their comfort and security on the line

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I am saved by God — the God who in Christ is reaching out
I am not saved by my spirituality... Christ died for the ungodly

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; rather, contemporary figures like William are used as 'messengers' of a grace they didn't create.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon treats the Great Commission as God's power working through the church, not the church's effort for God.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and joy; removal of the burden of 'being religious'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where God provides both the means and the community.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Trinity (internal relationship) to the Church (external relationship) is logically and theologically seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: All the dirt was assumed by God himself in the person of his Son as he died on the cross

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Savoir' (teaching) and 'Vouloir' (joy) to the church.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Universal and incapacitating ('Dirt' that makes us 'unlovely').

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, the 'ungodly' are the Receivers, and 'Religion' is the Opponent.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The current balance effectively subverts moralism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon brilliantly uses the Actantial model to dismantle 'religion' and replace it with the 'event' of the Trinity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'multicultural' anecdotes, Greimas reveals that these anecdotes serve to redefine the 'Object' of God's action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Greek of the Great Commission; Greimas shows how the sermon makes Jesus the Subject of the 'always being with us' promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes the 'Religion vs. Gospel' conflict as a structural opposition between human 'Devoir' and divine 'Pouvoir'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Dirt' as a powerful semiotic marker for the human condition.
